69f5cdc6-0542-498b-be10-e0466706e5e3.description: The Scrubs Online Career Exploration program allows students to explore multiple careers in healthcare and the professional skills needed to work in the field. Students will explore 10 or more high-need health care careers, research two or more fields of interest, identify education pathways, and develop professional skills. Students completing the program are encouraged to attend future Scrubs Camps, the HealthForce Minnesota in-person career exploration camp program hosted across Minnesota.
69f5cdc6-0542-498b-be10-e0466706e5e3.name: Scrubs Online Career Exploration

badge_template_activities.title: The student will complete the required five (5) healthcare career modules within the program (Licensed Practical Nurse, Surgical First Assistant, Radiologic Technician, Histology Technician, Phlebotomy Technician); completing the video, powerpoint and quiz hosted within each module; the student must receive at least 80% passing rate on the quiz in each of the five (5) modules.
Complete the required Professional Skills module, showing an understanding of writing a resume and cover letter, as well as writing a professional thank you.

Present with a partner(s) on a healthcare career presentation of 10 minutes in length.  The presentation is to exhibit the chosen healthcare career job duties, average salary, and education requirements needed for the career.

Write a 3-4 page paper of an individual chosen career explaining the reason the student is interested in the career, the average duties of the career, the average salary range of the career, the educational requirements needed for the career, and choosing a school within Minnesota where the student can receive the proper educational credentials to work in the chosen career field.
Attend two (2) live healthcare career presentations; or will watch at least two (2) of the live sessions and writing a 3 paragraph summary of the pre-recorded sessions.

c4415c37-63e9-4283-b062-8a5c24aef77e.description: Digital Citizenship Foundations badge earners build a strong foundation of professional knowledge, skills, and abilities in five important domains: digital footprints, literacy, etiquette, responsibility, and hygiene. Working together with an instructor in small groups for five weeks, earners assess their own digital citizenship and develop a personalized learning plan to guide their professional development. Earners gain membership in the ongoing WSU Digital Citizenship Network.
c4415c37-63e9-4283-b062-8a5c24aef77e.name: Digital Citizenship Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a five-week, instructor-led, online course, including three hours of interactive learning activities, group work, and performance-based assessments per week.
Engage with other members of your small "Tech Team" in weekly online discussions and group activities.
Evaluate your professional digital footprint, working with instructors to identify ways to improve your professional brand.
Assess your current level of digital literacy, working with instructors to identify skill, knowledge, and ability gaps.
Establish a personalized learning plan to guide your continued professional development as a digital citizen.

2fa363bf-5c37-40f7-bbf0-a3bbb5c8d103.description: Earners of the Initiative badge have exhibited foundational competency in their initiative and leadership skills. Earners are able to demonstrate self-efficacy, show the capacity to identify needs and respond proactively; demonstrate self-awareness; learn from both "failure" and "success," seeing them as opportunities to learn and develop; lead without an official "leader" role or title; motivate others and catalyze necessary action.
2fa363bf-5c37-40f7-bbf0-a3bbb5c8d103.name: Initiative

issuer.summary: issued by Winona State University and authorized by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

entity.name: Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

alignments.name: Education Design Lab 21st Century Skills Micro-credentials

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed four performance-based assessments, grounded in workplace scenarios, during a for-credit course or a co-curricular activity associated with a Minnesota State college or university.  Those assessments evaluated their abilities to A) lead without title, B) act as catalyst, C) demonstrate self-awareness, and D) learn from experience.

02dd1039-25b1-4abd-ace6-7d57596ba1af.description: Our focus in Leadership Bridge Series is on reinforcing our commitment to leading, supporting and encouraging employees by providing greater understanding of expectations for all of our leaders, and to provide you with tools to assist in cultivating greater employee engagement as a key driver to our continued success and relevance as a Company.
02dd1039-25b1-4abd-ace6-7d57596ba1af.name: Leadership Bridge Series

badge_template_activities.title: Leadership Bridge Series will provide the tools to create “will” among our team. The program design is for all Managers/Supervisors, we have been very intentional about providing team members with clear expectations of what it means to be a Servant leader to your teams.
Real Leadership is a powerful new workshop, designed to help participant express their leadership strengths, predict what others need from them as a leader, and produce a personal leadership plan.

With GROW® Coaching participants learn how to accelerate decision-making, improve accountability, communicate feedback quickly and effectively, and help teams keep commitments. In short, coaching helps people do their best work, which can give your organization a critical competitive edge.

Learn how to build awareness, create desire, develop knowledge, foster ability, and reinforce changes in your organization. The ADKAR Model is changing how we think about managing the people side of change and provides a powerful foundation to help you succeed at change. The perspective enabled by the ADKAR model allows you to view change in a new way. You can begin to see the barrier points and understand the levers that can move your changes forward. ADKAR allows you to understand why some cha

37fdbbd4-1468-4b89-80c7-9151110388b0.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional training from the Business Workforce Education (BWE) center from Rochester Community and Technical College. This badge also certifies that the recipient has expanded on their foundational Excel skills resulting in efficient use of spreadsheets in various projects and tasks
37fdbbd4-1468-4b89-80c7-9151110388b0.name: Excel Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Apply conditional formatting rules Utilize AutoFill Create absolute and relative cell references Link worksheets Create hyperlinks Protect workbook and worksheets Utilize name ranges Rotate cell contents

skills.name: Create Absolute And Relative Cell References

39404076-12a2-48dd-9c22-b03e98d827ca.description: 2022 Minnesota State IT Conference Professional Development badge earners engaged in the annual conference actively by participating in multiple sessions, reflecting upon what they learned, and networking with colleagues from around the system. They developed their professional skills and built a strong foundation for future collaboration and innovation within the Minnesota State system.
39404076-12a2-48dd-9c22-b03e98d827ca.name: 2022 Minnesota State IT Conference Professional Development Award

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least three conference sessions, including keynotes.
Contribute at least one "What I Learned" post to the session channels in the conference community site.
(Optional) Present or facilitate at least one conference session. Presenters can reduce the session attendance requirement by the number of sessions they present or facilitate.

841f8468-ce53-4479-a98b-d1be11ad0664.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional development training from the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI). This badge also certifies that this recipient has the ability to both design and carry out ethnographic research projects that can result in program improvement for an organization.
841f8468-ce53-4479-a98b-d1be11ad0664.name: Mayo Clinic Multicultural Education Certificate (MECP)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed 144 hours of the post-baccalaureate certificate program through hybrid formats including in-class, live online, and asynchronous self-study. Earner also successfully completed the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) and Intercultural Development Plan (IDP), identified an equity issue and researched such issue to present to a professional organization.

skills.name: Develop research proposal for Institutional Review Board (IRB)
Identity activities to develop cultural competence
Recognize equity issues in professional practice
Utilize tools and techniques of ethnographic research

3254acb8-4eec-4be0-8491-6ece5797b150.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional development training from the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI). This badge also certifies that this recipient has the ability to both design and carry out ethnographic research projects that can result in program improvement for an organization.
3254acb8-4eec-4be0-8491-6ece5797b150.name: Olmsted County - Multicultural Education Certificate Program (MECP)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed 144 hours of the post-baccalaureate certificate program through hybrid formats including in-class, live online, and asynchronous self-study. Earner also successfully completed the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) and Intercultural Development Plan (IDP), identified an equity issue, and researched such issue to present to professional org.

77f23ff2-b39f-49e2-81fd-4250ab563983.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional training from the Business Workforce Education (BWE) center from Rochester Community and Technical College. This badge also certifies that the recipient has acquired foundational skills in Microsoft Excel that can result in easy-to-read data to aid in data-based decision making.
77f23ff2-b39f-49e2-81fd-4250ab563983.name: Excel Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed 144 hours of the post-baccalaureate certificate program through hybrid formats including in-class, live online, and asyncronous self-study.  Earner also successfully completed the Intercultual Development Inventory (IDI) and Intercultural Development Plan (IDP), identified an equity issue and researched such issue to present to professional org.

6a30b570-8fd8-45e4-9388-e95d59312288.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional development training through guided research-based conversations on leadership topics including: resiliency, forward intention, sustainable leadership, realigned living, and designing purpose-filled teams. Participants had the opportunity to strategize how these principles would be practiced in their respective workplaces.
6a30b570-8fd8-45e4-9388-e95d59312288.name: Oliver Companies - Resiliency Training Series

badge_template_activities.title: The earner completed 6 hours of Oliver Companies Resiliency Series through in-person and online formats.

bb753134-30aa-4dde-a87a-42f549c9b81d.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional training from the Business Workforce Education (BWE) center from Rochester Community and Technical College. This badge also certifies that the recipient has the ability to design and apply data analytic tools and automate tasks in Microsoft Excel, producing effective reports and useable spreadsheets.
bb753134-30aa-4dde-a87a-42f549c9b81d.name: Excel Level 3

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed 5.33 hours of competency-based training, fully online, and asynchronous self-study. Earner also completed a task-based assessment demonstrating mastery by scoring 80% or above.

skills.name: Convert Text To Columns Insert And Edit And Format
Create And Edit And Run Macros
Create Formula Using Quick Access Toolbar
Create Formula Using The IF Function
Use Goal Seek And Error Checking

6c4c1a37-df62-49fe-bad8-5fcf21405a8f.description: This will be a seminar series focused on critical professional skills as hallmarks for effective leadership and overall professionalism in the workplace. The cohort of 10 – 15 JP Moms will stay together through all 8 sessions, building relationships with one another and learning through interaction and course content. Topics include professional presence, emotional intelligence, effective communication, introspection on one’s own leadership philosophy Learning Objectives
6c4c1a37-df62-49fe-bad8-5fcf21405a8f.name: Jeremiah Program: SGN Professional Training Leadership Seminar Series

badge_template_activities.title: The earner successfully completed 6 seminar sessions through in-person learning and interactive professional presence practice.

skills.name: engaging in and empowering relationship building
understanding core attributes and behaviors of effective leadership

6801bc5c-0989-4d84-91b2-df75ab8b3162.description: This badge certifies that the recipient received professional development training from the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI). This badge also certifies that this recipient has the ability to both design and carry out ethnographic research projects that can result in program improvement for an organization.
6801bc5c-0989-4d84-91b2-df75ab8b3162.name: Rochester Public Schools - Multicultural Education Certificate Program (MECP)

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed 144 hours of the post-baccalaureate certificate program through hybrid formats including in-class, live online, and asynchronous self-study.  Earner also successfully completed the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) and Intercultural Development Plan (IDP), identified an equity issue, and researched such issue to present to professional org.

0867be1d-f16a-43ba-80bc-c72a082a6628.description: Earners of the Collaboration badge have exhibited foundational competency in their collaboration and teamwork skills. Earners have shown their capacity to work productively with different individuals and groups toward a common goal; know how to strengthen relationships by incorporating diverse perspectives; use active listening skills; focus on solutions rather than problems.
0867be1d-f16a-43ba-80bc-c72a082a6628.name: Collaboration

f9bbc5e7-7bfb-47bc-b94c-2b914892b8a4.description: Earners of the Creative Problem Solving badge have exhibited foundational competencies in both divergent and convergent thinking; identified patterns that may not be obvious; managed ambiguity; and applied an iterative process for generating, testing and refining ideas. Earners have shown their capacity to generate fresh ideas and apply a process for evaluating them; and gathering information before settling on solutions prematurely.
f9bbc5e7-7bfb-47bc-b94c-2b914892b8a4.name: Creative Problem Solving

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed four performance-based assessments, grounded in workplace scenarios, during a for-credit course or a co-curricular activity associated with a Minnesota State college or university.  Those assessments evaluated their abilities to: A) utilize both divergent and convergent thinking, B) identify patterns that may not be obvious, C) manage ambiguity, and D) apply an iterative process for generating, testing and refining ideas.

f059bdc5-6627-44af-9405-4fd465cd374f.description: Earners of the Critical Thinking badge have exhibited foundational competency in their critical thinking skills. Earners have shown their capacity to gather and assess relevant information; identify patterns; question assumptions; and draw conclusions.
f059bdc5-6627-44af-9405-4fd465cd374f.name: Critical Thinking

9cbcd927-54f8-4f74-a8f6-0c65582f5666.description: Earners of the Empathy badge have exhibited foundational competency in their ability to listen actively, both to what is said explicitly and communicated non-verbally; recognize what others need and value; validate feelings and perceptions; and incorporate diverse perspectives.

24e2b3c7-2483-4c80-a1ee-fc23c5386de7.description: Earners of the Essentials of Leadership: Master badge have completed (5) 2-hour web-based modules in the Development Dimensions International (DDI) online program including topics: Communication Connecting through Conversations, Coaching Move People Forward, Building and Sustaining Trust, Driving Change, and Developing Yourself and Others.
24e2b3c7-2483-4c80-a1ee-fc23c5386de7.name: Essentials of Leadership: Master Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all 5 courses: 1. Communication Connecting through Conversations 2. Coaching Move People Forward 3. Building and Sustaining Trust 4. Driving Change 5. Developing Yourself and Others

148f150a-da88-4360-86c5-1df32285301f.description: Earners of the Essentials of Leadership: Professional badge have completed (3) 2-hour web-based modules in the Development Dimensions International (DDI) online program including (2) core topics: Communication Connecting through Conversations, Coaching Move People Forward; and (1) elective topic choices include Building and Sustaining Trust, Driving Change, or Developing Yourself and Others.
148f150a-da88-4360-86c5-1df32285301f.name: Essentials of Leadership: Professional Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3 of the 5 courses: 1. Communication Connecting through Conversations 2. Coaching Move People Forward 3. Building and Sustaining Trust 4. Driving Change 5. Developing Yourself and Others

2e9f361d-c1dd-4eee-a8ed-e7e44923ce03.description: Earners of the Intercultural Fluency badge have exhibited the foundational competency of recognizing and challenging their own cultural biases. Earners have shown their capacity to demonstrate cognitive and effective openness; evaluate their own performance; recognize their motivations; manage their anxiety; work effectively in multicultural settings; challenging their own thinking; and maximize group effectiveness.
2e9f361d-c1dd-4eee-a8ed-e7e44923ce03.name: Intercultural Fluency

5d23bcf8-a436-4561-b411-afec2350fad1.description: Earners of the Oral and Written Communications badge have exhibited foundational competency of their verbal and nonverbal communication skills. Earners can speak with clarity and precision in formal and informal contexts; use stories to communicate ideas; are aware of their audience; use appropriate tone and word choice; are active listeners who can "hear" both what is said and what is not said; can use body language effectively; can write effective, professional emails.
5d23bcf8-a436-4561-b411-afec2350fad1.name: Oral and Written Communications

672e51ce-0ff7-461b-998a-44ef0bd2856b.description: Earners of the Resilience Badge have exhibited the foundational competencies to learn from experience; exhibit flexibility; demonstrate self awareness; and focus on solutions.
